intro: Eriolaena leandrii, commonly known as the Leandrii hakea, is a small shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, needle-like foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is drought-tolerant and well adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Eriolaena leandrii is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
